snippet: Changes in the American electorate have left many Republicans, who have not won as many electoral votes as President Obama did on Tuesday in 24 years, concerned about the future.
abstract: Changes in American electorate leaves many Republicans concerned about the future of the party; Democrats, so far, have developed a far more successful strategy of appealing to changing views and demographics that are shaping the future; experts say Republicans must appeal to a broader audience if they hope to win elections going forward.
lead_paragraph: Changes in the American electorate have left many Republicans, who have not won as many electoral votes as President Obama did on Tuesday in 24 years, concerned about the future.

headline.seo: Obama’s Victory Presents G.O.P. With Demographic Test
headline.main: Demographic Shift Brings New Worry for Republicans
headline.print_headline: As Electorate Changes, Fresh Worry for G.O.P.
